duck: Cell migration - Cell migration is a central process in the development and maintenance of multicellular organisms.
In biology, motility is the ability to move spontaneously and actively, consuming energy in the process.
Biology Moving or having the power to move spontaneously: motile spores.

milestones: Media reports exaggerate cell phone risks again

wiki.text:
In biology, 'motility' is the ability to move spontaneously and actively,
consuming energy in the process. Most animals are motile but the term applies to
unicellular and simple multicellular organisms, as well as to some mechanisms of
fluid flow in multicellular organs, in addition to animal locomotion. Motile
marine animals are commonly called 'free-swimming'.

The opposite of motility is sessility.

Motility may also refer to an organism's ability to move food through its
digestive tract, i.e., peristaltics (gut motility, intestinal motility, etc.).<ref>http://emedicine.medscape.com/article/179937-
overview</ref>
wiki.title: motility
